qas.question: Which religion is widely practiced in Southeast Asia?
What percentage of the population in Southeast Asia practice Islam?
Among the Southeast Asian countries, which country has the most populous Muslims among them?
Roman Catholic population is predominant in which Asian country?
East Timor is predominantly catholic due to which European rule's history?
What is the least practiced religion in Southeast Asia?
WWhat Southeast Asian country has the smallest muslim population?
What religion is no longer predominant in East Timor?

context: <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>Islam<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> is the most widely practised religion in Southeast Asia, numbering approximately 240 million adherents which translate to about <a1_0>40%<a1_0/> of the entire population, with majorities in Indonesia, Brunei, Malaysia and in Southern Philippines with <a2_0><b7_0>Indonesia<b7_0/><a2_0/> as the largest and most populated Muslim country around the world. Countries in Southeast Asia practice many different religions. Buddhism is predominant in Thailand, Cambodia, Laos, Burma, Vietnam and Singapore. Ancestor worship and Confucianism are also widely practised in Vietnam and Singapore. Christianity is predominant in the Philippines, eastern Indonesia, East Malaysia and East Timor. The <a3_0>Philippines<a3_0/> has the largest Roman Catholic population in Asia. East Timor is also predominantly <b8_0>Roman Catholic<b8_0/> due to a history of <a4_0>Portuguese<a4_0/> rule.
